article.title: Hybrid quantum gates between flying photon and diamond nitrogen-vacancy centers assisted by optical microcavities

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the schematic diagram in Figure 1(a) represent?
choices: A diamond NV center coupled to a double-sided optical cavity.
A nitrogen-vacancy center in free space interacting with a single photon.
A diamond NV center embedded within a single-sided optical resonator.
A collection of NV centers interacting with a microwave field.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the significance of the |A₂) state in the energy-level diagram shown in Figure 1(b)?
choices: It is a stable ground state used for qubit encoding.
It acts as an auxiliary state decaying into |±) states with specific photon polarizations.
It represents a long-lived electron spin state used for information storage.
It is a dark state not involved in the optical transitions.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the role of the half-wave plate (HWP) in the CNOT gate quantum circuit depicted in Figure 2?
choices: To generate entanglement between the photon and NV center.
To perform a Hadamard operation on the electron spin qubit.
To implement a single-qubit operation on the output photon polarization.
To split the input photon into two orthogonal polarization components.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which operation does the Toffoli gate implemented by the quantum circuit in Figure 3 perform when the flying single photon (c₁) is in state |L)?
choices: A Hadamard operation on the first diamond NV center (NVc₂).
A swap operation between the states of the two diamond NV centers (NVc₂ and NVt).
A CNOT operation with the first NV center (NVc₂) as control and the second (NVt) as target.
A controlled-Z operation on both diamond NV centers (NVc₂ and NVt).

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the function of the optical switches (S₁ and S₂) in the Fredkin gate quantum circuit shown in Figure 4?
choices: To entangle the two target NV centers (NVt₁ and NVt₂).
To direct the photon through specific paths depending on its polarization.
To perform Hadamard operations on the target NV center electron spins.
To measure the polarization state of the output photon.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the reflection coefficient r(ωp) in Formula (3) describe?
choices: The probability of a photon being absorbed by the NV center.
The phase shift experienced by the photon after interacting with the NV-cavity system.
The ratio of the reflected and incident photon amplitudes for a specific frequency.
The efficiency of entanglement generation between the photon and NV center.
